input: Design a multi-case customer support workflow that automatically resolves simple issues, flags complex ones for agents, and tracks resolution performance.

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Structured case records containing text logs, timestamps, customer IDs, issue descriptions

inputs.name: I
inputs.input_data: Predefined rule set or ML model weights for complexity classification

inputs.name: P
inputs.input_data: Template responses mapped to common issue categories

inputs.name: E
inputs.input_data: Numeric complexity score threshold (0.0-1.0) for agent escalation

inputs.name: A
inputs.source_origin: Workforce Management System API (e.g., NICE inContact)
inputs.input_data: Real-time agent status (available/busy), skill mappings, queue assignments

inputs.name: P
inputs.input_data: Metric definitions (e.g., SLA adherence, first-contact resolution rate)

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Customer satisfaction scores (CSAT), Net Promoter Scores (NPS)

inputs.name: C
inputs.input_data: Calculated complexity score (0.0-1.0) using classification model on interaction data

inputs.name: E
inputs.input_data: Boolean flag indicating if case requires agent escalation

steps:
Uses: Customer Interaction Data
Action: Pull new case records from CRM API with webhook trigger
Produces: Raw case data buffer
Stores/Sends To: In-memory processing queue (Apache Kafka topic)

Uses: Customer Interaction Data, Issue Classification Rules/Model
Action: Apply NLP model to calculate complexity score (0.0-1.0)
Produces: Case Complexity Score
Stores/Sends To: Redis cache with 24hr TTL

Uses: Case Complexity Score, Escalation Threshold Parameter
Action: Compare score against threshold using binary classifier
Produces: Escalation Requirement Flag
Stores/Sends To: Decision matrix database table

Uses: Escalation Requirement Flag, Predefined Automated Responses
Action: When flag=false, select response template by issue category and send via CRM API
Produces: Automated Response Execution
Stores/Sends To: CRM interaction history, response tracking database

Uses: Escalation Requirement Flag, Agent Availability Status
Action: When flag=true, assign case to appropriate agent queue based on skill mapping
Produces: Agent Escalation Alert
Stores/Sends To: Workforce Management System queue endpoint

Uses: Case Status Update, Customer Feedback Data
Action: Aggregate resolution time, CSAT, and NPS data into metrics store
Produces: Resolution Performance Dashboard
Stores/Sends To: Analytics data warehouse (Snowflake/BigQuery)

Uses: Automated Response Execution, Agent Escalation Alert
Action: Write final status to CRM based on resolution pathway
Produces: Case Status Update
Stores/Sends To: CRM database, audit log system
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Customer Interaction Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: CRM/Support Ticket System API (e.g., Zendesk/Salesforce)
   Input Data: Structured case records containing text logs, timestamps, customer IDs, issue descriptions
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

2. Issue Classification Rules/Model
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Support Team Configuration Portal
   Input Data: Predefined rule set or ML model weights for complexity classification
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

3. Predefined Automated Responses
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Knowledge Base Management System
   Input Data: Template responses mapped to common issue categories
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

4. Escalation Threshold Parameter
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Workflow Configuration Interface
   Input Data: Numeric complexity score threshold (0.0-1.0) for agent escalation
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

5. Agent Availability Status
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Workforce Management System API (e.g., NICE inContact)
   Input Data: Real-time agent status (available/busy), skill mappings, queue assignments
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

6. Performance Metrics Definitions
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Analytics Configuration Tool
   Input Data: Metric definitions (e.g., SLA adherence, first-contact resolution rate)
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

7. Customer Feedback Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Post-Interaction Survey System API
   Input Data: Customer satisfaction scores (CSAT), Net Promoter Scores (NPS)
   Bound Reference: None
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

8. Case Complexity Score
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Derived from Input 1 & 2
   Input Data: Calculated complexity score (0.0-1.0) using classification model on interaction data
   Bound Reference: Input 1, Input 2
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

9. Escalation Requirement Flag
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Derived from Input 8 & 4
   Input Data: Boolean flag indicating if case requires agent escalation
   Bound Reference: Input 8, Input 4
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

Outputs:
1. Automated Response Execution
   Type: Triggered Action
   Description: Immediate response sent to customer via support channel
   Verification: Message delivery receipt, channel API response code

2. Agent Escalation Alert
   Type: System Update
   Description: Case assignment notification in agent workbench
   Verification: Queue update in WFM system, alert timestamp

3. Resolution Performance Dashboard
   Type: Measurable Report
   Description: Interactive dashboard showing SLA metrics, resolution times
   Verification: Dashboard API endpoint returns 200 OK with data payload

4. Case Status Update
   Type: Persisted State Change
   Description: Case record status transition (e.g., "Pending â†’ Resolved")
   Verification: CRM database record update timestamp

Steps:
Step 1: Ingest Customer Interaction
Uses: Customer Interaction Data
Action: Pull new case records from CRM API with webhook trigger
Produces: Raw case data buffer
Stores/Sends To: In-memory processing queue (Apache Kafka topic)

Step 2: Classify Issue Complexity
Uses: Customer Interaction Data, Issue Classification Rules/Model
Action: Apply NLP model to calculate complexity score (0.0-1.0)
Produces: Case Complexity Score
Stores/Sends To: Redis cache with 24hr TTL

Step 3: Evaluate Escalation Requirements
Uses: Case Complexity Score, Escalation Threshold Parameter
Action: Compare score against threshold using binary classifier
Produces: Escalation Requirement Flag
Stores/Sends To: Decision matrix database table

Step 4: Execute Automated Resolution
Uses: Escalation Requirement Flag, Predefined Automated Responses
Action: When flag=false, select response template by issue category and send via CRM API
Produces: Automated Response Execution
Stores/Sends To: CRM interaction history, response tracking database

Step 5: Route to Agent Queue
Uses: Escalation Requirement Flag, Agent Availability Status
Action: When flag=true, assign case to appropriate agent queue based on skill mapping
Produces: Agent Escalation Alert
Stores/Sends To: Workforce Management System queue endpoint

Step 6: Capture Resolution Metrics
Uses: Case Status Update, Customer Feedback Data
Action: Aggregate resolution time, CSAT, and NPS data into metrics store
Produces: Resolution Performance Dashboard
Stores/Sends To: Analytics data warehouse (Snowflake/BigQuery)

Step 7: Update Case Status
Uses: Automated Response Execution, Agent Escalation Alert
Action: Write final status to CRM based on resolution pathway
Produces: Case Status Update
Stores/Sends To: CRM database, audit log system
